name: sfchronicle
text: If the economy continues spiraling downward amid the coronavirus pandemic, public health officials will likely have to make some “hard choices," SFDPH's chief financial officer said. https://t.co/p5ml6vftCP

name: sfchronicle
text:
@LibbySchaaf UPDATE: Oakland's parks director says some nooses found in trees at Lake Merritt were "absolutely" not exercise equipment. 

“The symbolism of the rope hanging in the tree is malicious, regardless of the intent," said Nicholas Williams. Read more > https://t.co/CpriAqaJ3k https://t.co/xJ0zLJN0Ik

name: sfchronicle
text: Most of us think of Jackie Robinson as the singular superstar of baseball integration. But Willie Mays also played a major role, behind the headlines. https://t.co/LbFp0coUtd

name: sfchronicle
text:
Mayor @LibbySchaaf said Oakland authorities have launched a hate-crime investigation after nooses were found hanging on trees around Lake Merritt.  

“Objects that invoke such terror will not be tolerated in Oakland’s public spaces,” she said. https://t.co/yD8cDSFp2I

name: sfchronicle
text: JUST IN: SF Supervisors @MattHaneySF and @shamannwalton introduce a resolution calling for a “Post-Pandemic Housing Plan” to permanently house those temporarily sheltered in hotels and RVs. https://t.co/jjBT4T8pFy

name: sfchronicle
text: JUST IN: Bars, indoor dining, indoor religious services, gyms, bowling alleys, museums, hotels and more will be allowed to reopen July 1 in Contra Costa County. https://t.co/UbhBDnGzWG

name: sfchronicle
text:
The leader we could use right now?

None other than Willie Mays, writes @scottostler. Here's why: https://t.co/8kJ1sLoVEM

name: sfchronicle
text: Local health departments reported one additional death and 164 new cases of the coronavirus among California’s health care workers. https://t.co/5aYRd4tjaU

name: sfchronicle
text: Six more people, including four teenagers, have tested positive for the coronavirus in Mendocino County, health officials reported Wednesday. https://t.co/v8h8dH02s4

name: sfchronicle
text:
UPDATE: Oakland Mayor Libby Schaaf, in a news conference, said nooses were found in “roughly five different trees” around Lake Merritt and “we have to start with the assumption that these are hate crimes.” Schaaf said police had given evidence to the FBI.

https://t.co/stVbvOuOtI

name: sfchronicle
text: Restaurants, barber shops and gyms are among a slew of industries that can reopen in San Mateo County under a new health order issued Wednesday. https://t.co/yDEyMJZMvx

name: sfchronicle
text: UPDATE: California counties reported more than 4,000 new cases of the coronavirus Wednesday, a new single-day high for the state, according to data compiled by The Chronicle. https://t.co/4y8JnsIXFl

name: sfchronicle
text: JUST IN: A mountain lion seen prowling around San Francisco on Tuesday made another appearance on Wednesday — this time in the city’s East Cut neighborhood near Rincon Hill. https://t.co/I0QSty7PfP https://t.co/H3c2FFFctJ

name: sfchronicle
text: California health departments reported 4,134 new cases as of Wednesday evening, with four counties still yet to report. The state’s previous single-day high was 3,683 cases last Friday. https://t.co/J2WWYdrVRo

name: sfchronicle
text: Supporters of @BernieSanders want Rep. @RoKhanna to lead the state’s delegation to the Democratic National Convention, even though he didn’t support Joe Biden. They say it would be a show of unity. https://t.co/pd0QR9g5fw

name: sfchronicle
text: Wells Fargo Bank will make loans and credit cards available to young, undocumented immigrants in the DACA program — as long as it lasts — and pay up to $19.6 million to settle a lawsuit over its former policy. https://t.co/HWxfDthLyR

name: sfchronicle
text:
A 21-year-old S.F. man was arrested on suspicion of murder in last week’s fatal shooting of a woman in Hunters Point. 

The city's DA, citing insufficient evidence, has decided to hold off on charging the suspect. https://t.co/MPMbcRqAgd
